intro: Spermacoce laevigata var. hispida, commonly known as the rough sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pink flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticulture.
